ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introduction to several subfields of philosophy, how to analyze and argue against/for arguments, how to write for philosophy.
Learned to interact critically with philosophical texts, use logical form of argumentation, and write concisely. Gained substantial knowledge on the most important topics in metaphysics.
You learn how to break down an argument, the basics of metaphysics, and how to write a philosophy paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The seminar format makes it easier to grasp the key concepts and understand different perspectives on the issues discussed. That sometimes leads to off-topic tangents, though they may be interesting. Most readings, but not all, are equally accessible for novice philosophers. Also, there is limited guidance offered on writing.

Strengths: Very fun and interesting topics to talk about, readings covered big problems in metaphysics, and the professor was very engaging and knowledgeable. This is an awesome introductory philosophy course.

Weaknesses: We go through a lot of topics in the span of three months, so we aren't able to go very in-depth on any of them. We also didn't talk as much about writing strategies as I might've liked.
It's a great course so far as introducing the basics of philosophy/metaphysics. The environment is very relaxed and conducive to discussion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are interested in philosophy--note that the more popular topics are towards the end.

I would if you're interested in learning about metaphysics or if you're new to philosophy. I loved this course but make sure to keep track of deadlines. The course has very little homework from day to day but the papers will be a grind when assigned.
